title: Nebezpečí "ukradení" citlivých údajů
content:
Varování: možné bezpečnostní riziko

Firefox zjistil možné ohrožení bezpečnosti a stránku na serveru ct24.ceska.televize.cz nenačetl. Pokud se přesto rozhodnete stránku navštívit, útočníci se mohou pokusit zcizit vaše údaje jako např. hesla, e-mailové adresy nebo údaje o platební kartě.

Co s tím můžete dělat?

Příčina tohoto problému je pravděpodobně na straně serveru a vy ji bohužel nemůžete odstranit. Můžete o tomto problému informovat správce webu.

Zjistit více…

title: How to Open External Links without Exiting Firefox? How to open without Profile Manager Opening?
content:
When I try to open a link from an external software, in my case mostly discord, that which I click on, I get the profile manager opened, ask for which profile I should open from. If I already have the Firefox window for that profile open, I have to close the whole window and then it opens with all the tabs with a tab for the link I clicked on.

I would like to open tabs like how Chrome does, not asking for profile (yes, I know, I can just make things open on only one profile but I want to choose which one I want it to every single time without manager) and instead opens up from the profile window that I just had on.

I would like to open external links on an existing window and not close to open it.

So, ultimately, make my Firefox open link from the latest profile window I was on, and it does not require to close an existing window to open the link.
creator: xodiddl1009

title: Apple Time Machine for Recovering Lost Bookmarks Via Firefox Account Password Reset?
content:

I don't have any bookmarks backups, but I did recently back up my Macbook via Time Machine. Would Time Machine be able to recover my previous bookmarks? If so, how?

Thank you.

title: Error "Unable to find the proxy server" - macOS
content:
Just downloaded Firefox and I cannot for the life of me get it to access the web.

For starters, I am on OS Montery 12.7 and I use a hotspot for internet from my iPhone 7 (no other internet available).

I have set Firefox to use no proxy, and there is no proxy in use on the PC. The firewall is also disabled. Tried clearing the history (incl. cache) and still no dice.

I will try using a wifi connection when at uni next week, but I'd like to be able to use this while on hotspot as that is what I use 99% of the time.

Any help is really appreciated! Thanks.
creator: joshconnor178

title: Can't log into website: "This field is required" but field is already filled out.
content:
I can log into preply.com with Chrome and Edge, but always have problems with Firefox. I was able to log in once, but after that, I can't log back in.

Recently I had to reinstall Windows, and saw the opportunity to try getting this to work. Installed Firefox, but *before* I logged into Mozilla Sync (so I'm working with a 100% fresh installation with no history of having Firefox installed) I tried to log into preply.com. It worked. Then, I log myself out and try to log in again, and once more, I can't log back in. I'm attaching a screenshot of what I see when I try. Please note -- I have no bookmarks, no extensions, no addons, no browser history. Everything is tabula rasa.

I found this page:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/fix-login-issues-on-websites-require-passwords

and followed it to the letter, meticulously, to no avail. I still can't log into the site with Firefox. Chrome and Edge, yes. Firefox no. I only have Edge because I can't uninstall it. I only have Chrome for situations like this, where Firefox doesn't work. Firefox is my main browser, and I really, really would like to figure out what's happening. I can't understand how this problem persists when the browser is freshly installed; I haven't imported one bit of data yet from my sync account.

Can someone more experienced than me please help?
creator: tensor.field

title: Regular Crashes
content:
Firefox has been crashing multiple times per day for several weeks now. It used to be fine, hardly ever crashing. I can't think of anything I'm doing differently since before the crashes started. I can only assume that it started after a specific Firefox update. I do have a lot of windows/tabs open at once, but that was never an issue in the past. Occasionally individual pages will crash, usually several at once. The entire software crashes all at once regularly as well. Sometimes the crash seems to cause other issues, such as my computer hanging up for a bit, or my monitors going blank and the graphics system seeming to reset, before Firefox actually crashes. I don't always get a crash report dialogue when the whole thing crashes.

Most recent crash report ID: bp-bd37576c-c5ef-419f-a031-fe1910231123

I keep my Windows and Firefox up to date. I tried turning off hardware acceleration, but I think that might have made it worse so I turned it back on. I cleared the caches (which took well over five minutes), and ran speedyfox a few times. I exit Firefox through File > Exit whenever I need to restart or run other heavy software.
creator: klimber_2
